fidelity_criteria.criterion: Reward for accurately documenting the patient's chief concern: worsening rheumatoid arthritis pain and worry that hydroxychloroquine may be insufficient
Reward for capturing the patient's report of only slight, variable improvement since starting hydroxychloroquine
Reward for noting that the patient takes folic acid daily and that a support group reinforces adherence
Reward for recording the clinician's stated plan to give current therapy more time while monitoring closely and considering dose adjustment or alternative options if pain persists
Penalize for omitting or inaccurately listing any of the current medications and their doses (Methotrexate 15 mg weekly, Hydroxychloroquine 200 mg daily, Folic acid 1 mg daily)
Reward for including the documented allergy to sulfa drugs
Penalize for adding symptoms, histories, or examination findings not present in the transcript or chart
Reward for recording the patient's demographic information (55-year-old female)

appropriateness_criteria.criterion: Reward for including a plan for regular laboratory monitoring (e.g., CBC, liver enzymes) appropriate for methotrexate therapy
Reward for recommending baseline and periodic ophthalmologic screening due to hydroxychloroquine use
Reward for reinforcing continued daily folic acid supplementation to mitigate methotrexate toxicity, demonstrating evidence-based counseling
Penalize for failing to outline an evidence-based escalation strategy (dose adjustment or addition/change of DMARDs) if pain remains uncontrolled
Penalize for proposing any medication dose increase or new therapy without an accompanying safety or monitoring plan
